stories.text:
A part of me is overloaded with tons of news (which turn out being a noise after all) and «Last hour Ipad deals!!!» garbage in RSS. Another part thinks all the worthy news are showing up on HN within a few hours anyway.

The question is, am I missing out on anything if I only visit HN?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it even worth reading news outside of HN?
The Five-Day Office Week Isn’t Coming Back. WFH Is Here to Stay

stories.text:

stories.title: Blumentals Surfblocker v5.x password exploitation
Does the Metaverse Need a Zoning Board?

stories.text: Does anyone use or know of a tool that will auto generate test cases based on openapi specs and execute those?
stories.title: Ask HN: Automated test case generator for openapi sepc

stories.text:
I’m fascinated by how MIT Media Lab has been and continues to be funded mainly by corporate sponsorships.

Wondering what the main driver is for companies to sponsor the R&D work.

Are there more examples of R&D Labs that rely on external corp. sponsorship deals?
stories.title: Ask HN: What’s the main reason companies sponsor MIT Media Lab?

stories.text: I remember as a kid, getting excited about what new tech would be released every year, but for the last few years if you search 'hottest new tech' it's always some combination of speakers, headphones, phones and laptops. I want some cool new tech, but are we past the revolutionary generation? Will tech only be evolutionary from now on?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why is all new tech the same?
WHO lists 9th Covid-19 vaccine for emergency use with aim to increase access
